result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Thomas Gordon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Earl Thomas Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present, however, was called to an accident scene. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Hall is in trial and unable to appear.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon not in court, in custody in Eau Claire County.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Earl Thomas Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defendant unable to be produced from Eau Claire. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon in court, in custody in Eau Claire.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl Thomas Gordon appeared by video means.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointing of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DMR,; AEK,; RJ,; JJM,; SDW,;
No Contact Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Earl Thomas Gordon in custody in Eau Claire Co.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl Thomas Gordon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
